</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> 1.38 </value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Variables </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> Using [[profileNamespace]] and [[uiNamespace]] with this command has been disabled in multiplayer. [https://forums.bistudio.com/topic/140837-development-branch-changelog/page-28#entry2869646 Changelog]</value></part><part><name>MP</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns a list of all variables from desired namespace. Namespaces supported:<br>
*[[Control]] - ''Since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v2.01''
*[[Display]] - ''Since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v2.01''
*[[Team Member]]
*[[Namespace]]
*[[Object]]
*[[Group]]
*[[Task]]
*[[Location]]
</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________


</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''allVariables''' namespace </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name> p1</name>=<value> namespace: [[Control]] (''Since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v2.01''), [[Display]] (''Since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v2.01'')  [[Team Member]], [[Namespace]], [[Object]], [[Group]], [[Task]], [[Location]] </value></part><part><name/>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] of [[String]]s - array of variable names. All names are in lower case (see [[toLower]])</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name> x1</name>=<value> <code>_allVarsUINamespace = [[allVariables]] [[uiNamespace]];</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 
</value></part><part><name> x2</name>=<value> <code>_allVarsTrigger = [[allVariables]] trigger1;</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[allControls]], [[allDisplays]], [[allCurators]], [[allGroups]], [[allDead]], [[allDeadMen]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value>

[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 1, 2016 - 23:54 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:longbow|longbow]]</dt>
<dd class="note">One still can use [[allVariables]] in Multiplayer against [[profileNamespace]] and [[uiNamespace]] using config parser. In [[Description.ext]]
<code>_EXEC(somevar = allVariables profileNamespace)</code>
in code
<code>_allprofilevars = parsingNamespace getVariable "somevar"</code>
but list will be valid only at the moment of parsing config.
</dd>
</dl>
